Red Cabbage and Onion Slaw Recipe | Bon Appétit

Let sit until they start to release their water, 8–10 minutes, then begin to massage, gently at first so they don’t break, then harder as they begin to expel their liquid, until softened to about the texture of coleslaw. Pour off all excess liquid and add vinegar and oil; toss to coat. Taste and season with more salt if needed.Step 2Do Ahead: Slaw can be made 3 days ahead. Cover and chill.How would you rate Red Cabbage and Onion Slaw?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (3)Back to TopTriangleGreat, simple recipe with a lot of flavor.  I don't care for traditional coleslaw, but this one is delicious.  It's much lighter are more flavorful.AnonymousPortland, ME1/26/2022Great recipe, this slaw became an immediate staple at home. I have used other vinegars as well, but rice vinegar is the best for this. AnonymousSan Francisco, CA6/28/2021I make this all the time, minus the onions. The salting and squeeze out of the excess water makes the slow crunchy rather than slimy.
